english: member; person engaged in a field

etymology.description: 𠚤(鼎) (dǐng, "tripod") top edge depicted by 〇 = indicates fullness or a complete member -> association with people engaged in a field
etymology.interpretation: The character 員(員) (yuán, "member") visually represents the top edge of a 鼎(鼎) (dǐng, "tripod"), symbolizing completeness or full membership in a group. This is metaphorically extended to mean a person who is a member or part of an organization.
etymology.simplification: Simplified to 员(員) by replacing 貝(貝) (bèi, "cowry") with 贝(贝) (bèi, phonetic similarity), maintaining meaning while simplifying the structure.

examples.chinese: 他是乐团的核心员(他是樂團的核心員)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì yuètuán de héxīn yuán.
examples.english: He is the core member of the orchestra.

examples.chinese: 她是图书馆的研究员(她是圖書館的研究員)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shì túshūguǎn de yánjiū yuán.
examples.english: She is a researcher at the library.

examples.chinese: 他报名成为正式员(他報名成爲正式員)，准备在领域内大展身手(準備在領域內大展身手)。
examples.pinyin: Tā bàomíng chéngwéi zhèngshì yuán, zhǔnbèi zài lǐngyù nèi dàzhǎn shēnshǒu.
examples.english: He signed up as a formal member and is preparing to showcase his skills in the field.
